Name: Blacks & Whites: 50th Anniversary Edition – Go Brandon Variant Pack
Description:
An expansion pack to Blacks & Whites: 50th Anniversary Edition – because racism didn't end in 2020!

All-new game cards based on the events of 2021 & 2022 – the pandemic, the Biden administration, etc. – with new jokes, artwork, and the harsh realities of a “post-racial” society.

9 "Proof of Vaccination" cards, 4 new property/Deed cards, and 23 new game cards for "vaccinated-only" players.

Name: Wrummy
Description:
Wrummy (Word Rummy) is a card game where players collect letter fragments to construct words. The game is played similar in concept to the card game 500 Rummy.

160 cards comprise single letters plus 2- and 3-letter fragments (biography, trigraphs).

[The above from the rules sheet.]

Players are dealt 7 cards, and the top card of the deck is turned over to start the discard pile. In their turn, a player:

- Draws: 
—- The top card of the deck.
—- Any card of the discard pile, and all cards above it. This can only be done if the bottom card drawn is immediately used to make a word from the hand. 
- Does one of the following:
—- Melds a new word using cards from the hand. 
—- Add one or more letter from the hand to a word on the table make one or more new words using all its letters, and claiming the new word if previously owned by another player.
- Discards a card from the hand.

The round ends when a player empties their hand. Players score for all the words they own, and subtract the value of all cards left in their hand. Play until someone reaches an agreed goal total.

Name: Raidziu Loto
Description:
A very simple game for learning letters in the Lithuanian alphabet. There are 8 cardboard boards (7” x 8.5”), on which are all the letters of the alphabet, 4 per board, each with a picture; and 64 cardboard tiles (2.5” x 2.75”), each with a letter on it.  To play, the tiles are scattered face up on the table; a child takes a board and looks for the letters on the board, and on finding one, takes the tile, covers the letter on their board, and says the letter and the item pictured that starts with that letter. The one who completes their board first wins.

It also says words and sentences can be made with the tiles, and indeed the frequency of the letters looks like it correlates with the frequency of use in everyday language use; but there are no rules for games or activities for spelling words.

Name: Auction Charades
Description: A fun and extremely competitive version of the classic game of Charades, 'AUCTION CHARADES' brings in hilarious and challenging variations, multi-difficulty levels, over 750 Bollywood and 750 Hollywood/TV movies, all with the exhilarating thrill of an Auction for time! One of the only games that can be played by much larger groups, connects with a very diverse demographic and is always engaging everyone around.

Name: The Maze Explorers: Dark World
Description:
You and your fellow intrepid explorers have chosen to venture into a dark unmapped maze.

Using only your wits, a flashlight and a limited supply of batteries you must navigate and expose the hidden maze path. You will encounter artifacts that help or hinder you. You may even find yourself stranded in the dark. Be the hero that exposes the maze path and finds the exit!

Your goal is to create a complete, unbroken maze path between the Maze Entrance and the Maze Exit and be the first Explorer to exit the maze. However, be careful not to get stranded in the maze without flashlight Batteries to light your way.

The Maze Explorers – Dark World is the first in a series of maze worlds. Each world will have its own set of unique artifacts and challenges. Each world will be playable as a stand-alone game or can be combined into a larger meta-world.

—description from the designer

Name: GOOCON Dice 1v1 Basketball
Description:
The dice determine distance traveled and field goal percentage.
The player controls the walking direction.
Attacker can choose to move or shoot.

First to 15 points wins.

Name: Rough!: The Board Game
Description:
Earn the respect of your fellow citizens by being the first to gain 12 stars and making it to Starfish Town. But be wary, the landscape is treacherous, and you will have to be prepared to encounter flash floods, lightning, crows, worms, earthquakes, high winds and even bears! This is a turn-based, resource-managing, survival, racing game. This is Rough baby!
 Traversing forests, and lakes, mountains and open fields, would be a challenge, but with the aid of a few scattered trading posts, caves and tents, you'll be able to equip and assist yourself along the way.

Each turn a player will be able to roll a custom dice 3 times to hike their pawn across the open grid-like board, gathering resources onto their player mat freely as they go. With every roll of the dice you can get a hike(Move 1 space), a hungry(discard 1 Berry or Fish and Move 1 space), or a disaster(end your turn and draw a Disaster Card). Throughout gameplay you will acquire cards that give you special abilities during future turns, make trades at Trading Posts located on the board for helpful tools and even have the chance to make a friend with a bear. 
 Player's have a limited amount of space in their backpack, so they have to be strategic with what and how much of each resource to carry along with them.
 The most unique mechanic of the game is the Disaster Deck. The backs of the cards are disasters that will happen to the board or all players(everyone at the table sees this side), but the fronts are helpful abilities that only you can see and use. So as long as you are holding on to the cards in your hand, the disasters on those cards will always be a threat to the progress of all players.

—description from the designer

Name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Mutant Genesis
Description:
The world is always in need of heroes. In order to truly achieve peace, there are times when we must put aside our differences and focus on doing what is right. That is exactly what the X-Men do, and their story is all about their fight to protect a world that hates and fears them. Now, the X-Men have finally joined the fight in Marvel Champions: The Card Game!

As the game’s fifth campaign expansion, Mutant Genesis adds a plethora of classic X-Men characters to the scene, including two new playable heroes, Colossus and Shadowcat, each of which comes with a pre-built deck ready to play from the get-go. Face off against iconic villains, such as Sabretooth, Sentinels, and Magneto, and work together to overcome a fresh batch of challenges. This expansion includes five brand-new scenarios, each of which can be played individually or as part of a larger campaign.

Whether you’re a longtime fan or have only just started playing, anyone who enjoys Marvel Champions won’t want to miss out on Mutant Genesis!

-description from publisher's website
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

Name: Full Moon: The Beast of Gevaudan
Description:
Full Moon: The Beast of Gevaudan is a brutal solo roll and write inspired by the myth of the beast that ravaged the French countryside in the mid 1700s.

In this game you play as the beast, a werewolf struggling to survive as paranoia grows constantly, unable control your werewolf form.

Can you maintain your village guise for the month? the season? the year? The experience is harrowing, and you will need to push your luck to see how long you can survive. Are you ready to roll the dice?

—description from the designer

Name: Americana Cards
Description:
A game celebrating the USA during its Bicentennial year. It has 50 state cards, each with the following info: 

     The state's name. 
     The capital city of another state (used for game 1). (The first letters of the state and city names's are large, used in games 3 and 5.)
     A silhouette of the state, showing its capital, with abbreviations of neighboring states and water bodies around its perimeter. 
     Three numbers in the range 1-50, showing the state's:
         order in joining the US (blue ink)
         rank in size, 1 being largest (black ink)
         rank in population (as of 1975) (red ink)
    


There are also 6 wild cards, show different American icons (Old Glory, Statue of Liberty, US Capitol, the Constitution, Liberty Bell, and 1st moon landing), each worth 25 points.

There are rules for five games:

1. State Capitals. Match the listed capital city on the top card on the table with its state card in your hand, or vice versa; otherwise play a card onto the top of the table pile. If you make a match you get all the cards on the table and score their blue numbers.

2. Build the Country. Play any cards from your hand next to table cards they are neighbors to, as shown on their maps, or play any card to the table if you cannot. A successful neighboring play earns you the maximum of the 3 numbers on the card.

3. Match-Em. Play a card so one of the first letters or its state or capital name matches one of the first letters of the top table card; or just play a card onto the top of the table pile. If you match you keep all the current table cards, scoring the numbers next to the words whose initials you matched, and the same spot in all cards under the top card.

4. Hi-Number. Play a card whose blue number is higher than the last card played, or pass. If you play the last card in the current trick you keep the played cards and score the blue number of each of them.

5. Americana. Play one or more cards so that one large initial of each of them adds to a growing word on the table, or just play one card to start a new word. If you complete a valid word you keep its cards and score their blue numbers. Valid words are those about anything about America: a state or city name, famous person, work of art, invention, etc.

For each of these games, you refill your hand after play, and the target score for a win is 1776.

—user summary

Name: Classic Card Game Compendium
Description:
Three great card games in one.  Take your choice from Pit, the corner the market game; Whot, the fast moving numbers and shapes game; or Lexicon, the classic word game.

You'll have the chance to play all three with the Top Cards Classic Compendium.

[The above adapted from the box bottom]

The rules for the three games are all in a single rules sheet.
The decks of cards have backs not seen in non-Winning Moves editions.

Name: Into The Echoside: Cupcake
Description:
A promotional card in the Psychopathic faction for Into The Echoside only obtainable from DCG con. It is a slightly different size and thickness than the other cards, likely requiring sleeves for play.

Costs 5 Karma, Worth 2GP

Effect: +1 Karma & draw a Flavor Card

Name: Iron Helm: The Fanny Pack
Description:
The Fanny Pack is a booster packs meant to enhance the base game of Iron Helm. You will need a copy of the base game of Iron Helm to enjoy this pack. The Fanny Pack adds new Characters, Trappings, Loot, Enemies, Plots, and more to the base game.

Simply add the cards from this pack to your base game. You can always use the icons at the top of the card to remove this pack at a later time if you ever want to return the base game to its original form, but I doubt you will...

The included Artifact Card requires the expansion Iron Chest to be used.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ancient Merchant
Description:
When the silk road was expanded, the trade between different cities was developed. Everyday many merchants started to join this  trade to achieve money and fame.
In this game the players are playing in the role of merchants  who are competing to achieve the place of the best merchant in the world. So they travel to different places and buy goods by  Participating the auction. Then they transfer the goods  to other place and sell them to achieve fame and wealth.

—description from the designer

Name: Arcs: The Blighted Reach Expansion
Description:
By adding the Blighted Reach Campaign Expansion, you can also play Arcs in an innovative micro-campaign, where each game is one episode in an epic trilogy that stretches across an even larger galaxy.

Everyone begins as petty regents in a dying empire, but your fates quickly diverge. The campaign contains twenty-four fate seeds, each with tons of branches, twists, and turns. Uncover lost knowledge, guide your people to a new home, or forge a galactic confederation!

As you complete objectives and make critical decisions, the campaign grows and changes. If you destroy a world, its refugees might flood the galaxy in your next game. If you find your society driven to a state of collapse, you can even abandon your homeworld and play the next game operating out of a lone flagship.

Each game in the campaign takes less than two hours to play. You can sit down for a single skirmish and then pack up for another day, or settle in for an epic three-act saga! Just make sure to stretch and drink some water between games.

—description from the publisher

Name: Deathly Thrones
Description:
Deathly Thrones is a print at home solitaire roguelike game using a deck of 52 playing cards and a quest booklet in a "zine" format.

Playing cards are used in an original way.
The 1 to 9 â™¡ and â™¤ cards are the Health and Armor counters.
The 1 to 9 â™§ and â™¢ cards are the Battle cards.
The rest of the cards, the 10 to King of all colors, are the Steps cards.

Each turn the player follow 3 phases:

     Draw a step cards: Then, read the quest to move your character to this event.
     Apply the event: Take a nap, fall in a trap, fight monsters, etc
     Check: If the player manage to succeed the event, they start over from phase [1]. If they didn't, they lose. If they beat the boss at the 40th step, they won!


It take less than one minute to setup and each game takes 10-20 minutes. The rules are simple, you choose your hero, note your health and armor, and then select a quest 'zine to conquer a new throne!

Game published in 'Print&Play' format and delivery in two versions: A zine one containing the pages for all the quests that it can be fold into booklets ; A standalone one, that they can reference on digital devices or print for a non-folding reference sheet.

—description from the desiger

Name: Pawclaw Mini Expansion
Description:
This mini expansion can be added to Iron Forest and ICECOOL/ICECOOL2. It comes with 1 flickable miniature and 7 honey barrel tokens.

This mechanical bear is crazy for honey! This mini expansion essentially gives you an extra turn, but with the Pawclaw miniature.

In Iron Forest this mini expansion can be added to any scenario. The team that has most honey tokens acquired at the end of their turn, gets to use the Pawclaw miniature to help achieve their scenario goal.

In ICECOOL each player collects honey barrel tokens, which can be exchanged for an extra turn with Pawclaw to help you get the fish or catch the rascals.

Name: The Emperor Mini Expansion
Description:
This mini expansion can be added to Iron Forest and ICECOOL/ICECOOL2. This expansion comes with 1 flickable miniature and 6 snowflake tokens.

In Iron Forest this mini expansion can be added to any scenario. The Emperor is trying to freeze both teams' mechas. If a team's all mechas are frozen, they lose the scenario.

In ICECOOL "The Emperor" lets you mess with other players or help yourself. By collecting snowflake tokens, you can move fish onto any other door or exchange your fish cards with new ones from the deck.

Name: Solo Hockey
Description: Solo Hockey is a “ROLL THE DICE AND SEE WHAT HAPPENED” type sport game for 1-2 players. The game is designed to provide excitement and realistic statistics while maintaining as much playability as possible. Only main game events affecting the outcome are recreated.

Name: X-Ceter-O x X
Description: This game is a mash up between X-ceter-O and Tic Tac Toe times ten; it's played on a grid of nine Tic Tac Toes (like Tic Tac Toe times Ten) and requires winning three games of Tic Tac Toe in a row, but using the rules of X-ceter-O on each of the Tic Tac Toe fields.

Name: SIXGEMS
Description:
In SIXGEMS, players play gem cards to a tableau in front of them in order to manipulate dice around a central area.  The gem cards show die faces that affect which dice can be moved, and if their face is adjusted.

The players then have the option to play an account settlement card which may grant certain bonuses, but also triggers a scoring where players earn points for the gems they hold corresponding to the location and face of the blue dice, and lose points in the same manner for the red die.

After a certain number of account settlements have been triggered, the game ends and the person with the most points wins.

Name: Treacherous Trails
Description:
In Treacherous Trails, the players begin as pioneers in the American Mid-West, and must take the money they start with and decide how to use it as they travel across the West, to their destination on the Pacific coast.

Should they buy a wagon and mule team, or use oxen? Go light and ride on horseback with a pack mule? And what provisions to pack; should they carry a lot of food or hope to hunt and forage along the way? And what kind of gear? Should they spend all the money or save some for the destination? Not knowing what they will encounter on the trail, they must use their best judgement, and no matter how often the game is played, the cards (including random events) will change and the results will vary, even if the same choices are made at the outset.  The replayability is high, in this family-friendly, yet competitive game of the American West.

There are 5 trail choices you may take, or you can play as an outlaw along a trail, and once their trails & equipment have been chosen, the game begins. Players vie to reach their cities and then select a career and amass wealth, as they establish themselves on the West coast!

Name: Thieves of Dorantia
Description:
No Loyalty Among Thieves!

After being hired by the thieves guild to seek out and eliminate one of their very own, your adventurers play a dangerous game of cat and mouse that turns into a whodunit, on the streets of Dorantia!

Thieves of Dorantia is a high-stakes hex-crawl adventure, featuring:

Rules for new weapon type - pole weapons.
Rules for new dungeon tile type - narrow corridor.
Three new classes - street enforcer, street mage, and scout.
Hex-crawl chase game with gather information mechanic,
city guard, incarceration, twelve city locations and citizens.
City tunnel system with forgotten passageways.
New spells, traps, magic items, and treasure.
Nine unique Final Boss fights.

Requires Four Against Darkness

-description from designer

Name: Banners
Description:
Banners is a tactical game that utilizes hand-management, tile-placement, area-control, and a intriguing scoring system. Players will be placing cards from their hands to the table in an attempt to secure location cards at the end of the game. There are five factions vying for power of these locations and each faction consists of six cards ranging in value from 1-6. Player will not know what factions their opponents are making secret alliances with until the big reveal at the end of the game. Each player will end the game with 3 cards remaining in their hand and these will indicate which factions they have made alliances with. All locations are then scored and given to each faction. The player with the most valuable cards for each faction will gain all the victory points for the corresponding locations!

Players will also be attempting to place cards in clever ways as to grab shiny bronze coins, which are also worth victory points. Placing a Hag card allows the player to move the Hag from location to location and then move previously placed cards to a new position on the table, potentially messing up an opponent's plan or bolstering their own. Lastly, the sneaky Troll card can be played to steal a coin from any location and then allow that player to immediately take another turn.

-description from designer

Name: Roll and Colour: Notepads
Description:
A roll and write game with a difference — it’s all about colouring! Simple game which can be a relaxing solo experience or a competitive race, with easy, medium and hard versions.

The game is played on small A6 sheets. Each shows a 3x3 grid with 17 shapes drawn across the grid. Columns are numbered 1,2,3 while rows are labelled 4,5,6. A different colour is also assigned to each number.

Roll four dice. Choose a column, row, and colour from the four results. Select an appropriate shape and colour it in. Repeat until one player has filled in their sheet.

The aim of the game is the end up with non-adjacent colours. Score one point for each shape which does NOT share a grid square with a shape of the same colour. On easy sheets score an additional point for each of the six colours used, while on harder sheets score for colours used on different types of shapes, or for a specific shape.

Comes with three different designs: tulips (easy), frogs and lilies (medium), and balloons (hard).

-description from publisher

Name: Esculenta
Description:
Esculenta (named after the taro plant) is an original  2-player Tarock game with an ordinary deck of cards. It’s aim is to fill a gap in the genre to provide 2-player experience of the same feel and depth as found in traditional games, yet with its own personality and strategies. Like all tarock, Esculenta is distinguished by a super-long trump suit with the other cards being where one score most of the points: in this case half the deck, 20 cards, are trump! Players bid to win the most card points but often gain even more points from declaring to achieve certain bonus feats in tricks, such as taking the last trick with the lowest trump. 
In addition to the fact it’s played with a regular deck, distinctions include declarer going against a defender who plays two cards to the three card trick with the help of a mini-dummy, and an idiosyncratic trick-playing order. The dummy is played by defender (so it's 2:1) but this is offset by the fact the declarer can often maintain the lead by forcing dummy to win.

Esculenta is part of the "Twisted Dummy" series: 2 player adaptations of traditional games using dummy third hand used in innovative ways.
—description from the designer

Name: The Zorro Dice Game: Equipment Pack #2
Description:
This has 6 Common Equipment and 2 Premium Equipment. It contains:
Bandana
Bolos
Charm
Gauntlets
Goat
Pitchfork
Amulet
Chalice

It was released with the Stunts and Allies expansion Kickstarter campaign but it works with any combination of base game or expansions.

Name: The Zorro Dice Game: Ally Pack #1
Description:
This has 4 Allies for use with Stunts and Allies expansion to The Zorro Dice Game. It contains:
Ana Maria Verdugo
Zorro's Fighting Legion
Joaquin Murrieta
Jose of the Cocopahs

Name: Obscure Battles 6: A Cruel Sea
Description:
In "Obscure Battles Volume 6 – A Cruel Sea", the player takes the role of a Submarine commmander trying to locate and destroy enemy shipping on a patrol.

This is a exclusively solitaire game: you don’t need any other player to play the game. Extremely fast playing and simple but detailed , fun game - just a A3 for your map board, the game is extremely easy to play. Just roll a single D6 and pick the targets then see if you can execute a successful attack and then survive to tell the tale !

Game comes with 8 Submarines: German Type 21 and 7C from WW2 and UC/III from WW1, French Surcouf, Japanese Junsen 2 , US Gato from WW2, Soviet Foxtrot and one special yellow submarine :) .

Play the standart game or you can also design your own missions using the supplied Submarine Info , Target ad Escort Type Cards. There are more Submarine types and loadouts that are provided as part of the optional packs.

Your targets are selected from  different decks of cards such as different freighter types, fishing vessel, troop Ships, tankers, capital warships etc.

Your submarine will not be safe out there: there are several usual ASW escorts such as Destroyers, Frigates, ASW Planes, Corvettes and and even Q-Ships.

There is also special set of "named" Target and Escort cards that come with their own name such "HMS Saltash Castle", "USS England" and "IJN Shigure" and more.
Finally, the combat cards give you the expected unexpectedness of the life at sea.

—description from the publisher

Name: Das kleine böse Kartenspiel
Description:
The Little Bad Book gets a companion: The Little Evil Card Game! All the evil monsters and characters from the Little Bad Books have sneaked out of the books and are now up to mischief! Only you can banish them back into the books by defeating the Little Evil Card Game. But be careful: With wild changes of direction, nasty abandonment or the funny evil tasks of the curse cards, the game knows all the evil tricks to make it as hard as possible for you!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Das kleine Böse Buch bekommt einen Mitstreiter: Das kleine Böse Kartenspiel! Alle bösen Monster und Figuren aus den kleinen Bösen Büchern haben sich aus den Büchern geschlichen und treiben nun ihr Unwesen! Nur du kannst sie wieder zurück in die Bücher bannen, in dem du das kleine Böse Kartenspiel besiegst. Aber Vorsicht: Mit wilden Richtungswechseln, fiesem Aussetzen oder den lustig-bösen Aufgaben der Fluchkarten kennt das Spiel alle bösen Tricks, um es dir so schwer wie möglich zu machen!

—description from the publisher

Name: Roll for Valor
Description:
Roll for Valor is a competitive roll and write set in a fantasy world where the Dwarven Vergar Empire seeks to subdue all other free people. Recruit and muster your volunteer units of elves, orcs, free dwarves, ciar, and humans. You will gain bonuses and unlock ballista and dragons to protect yourselves and your gold. The player with the largest army at the end of 15 days wins. Players roll a pool of dice, earn extra dice, and might even unlock bonuses on 20 sided dice while recording their recruitment. Dragons are powerful allies, but be careful as they may devour the gold you need to muster your forces.

—description from the designer

Name: Dziki futbol
Description:
African animals gather on the savannah to watch the Wildlife League final. Who will be the winner? The Brave Lions or the Charging Rhinos?

Players lead their teams to victory in the final game. To win the trophy, a team must win 2 games.

Players shuffle the Action cards and the Referee cards to create two decks of face down cards.

The Ball marker will move from player to player during the game, depending on how the game goes. The Action card is always revealed by the player who is in possession of the ball.
The player with the ball reveals the first card from the Action card pile and considers its effect.

After the Action card or the Referee card has been drawn, each player's active player cards are discarded into the discard pile.
A player takes a shot at the goal when a Shot Action card is revealed or it results from the contents of other Action cards. 
If a Referee card is drawn players consider a card from the Referee card pile e.g. penalty kick, free kick, injury.

—description from the publisher (translated)

AfrykaÅ„skie zwierzÄ™ta gromadzÄ… siÄ™ na sawannie, aby zobaczyÄ‡ finaÅ‚ Ligi Dzikich ZwierzÄ…t. Kto zostanie zwyciÄ™zcÄ…? OdwaÅ¼ne Lwy czy SzarÅ¼ujÄ…ce NosoroÅ¼ce?

Gracze prowadzÄ… swoje druÅ¼yny do zwyciÄ™stwa w finaÅ‚owym meczu. Aby zdobyÄ‡ puchar, druÅ¼yna musi wygraÄ‡ 2 mecze.
Gracze tasujÄ… karty Akcji i karty SÄ™dziego, tworzÄ…c dwie talie zakrytych kart.
Znacznik PiÅ‚ki w trakcie gry bÄ™dzie przechodziÅ‚ z jednego gracza do drugiego, w zaleÅ¼noÅ›ci od przebiegu gry. KartÄ™ Akcji zawsze odkrywa gracz, który jest w posiadaniu piÅ‚ki.
Gracz przy piÅ‚ce odkrywa ze stosu kart Akcji pierwszÄ… kartÄ™ i rozpatruje jej efekt.
Po wykonaniu akcji z karty Akcji lub karty SÄ™dziego, karty aktywnych zawodników kaÅ¼dego gracza zostajÄ… odrzucone na stos kart wykorzystanych.
Gracz oddaje strzaÅ‚ na bramkÄ™ w momencie, gdy zostanie odsÅ‚oniÄ™ta karta Akcji albo wynika on z treÅ›ci innych kart. 
JeÅ›li wylosowana zostanie karta SÄ™dziego gracze rozpatrujÄ… kartÄ™ ze stosu kart SÄ™dziego np. rzut karny, rzut wolny, kontuzja.

—description from the publisher

Name: Yoncollon Duel
Description:
Yonocollon Die are specialized dice with four faces.  While each die has a primitive shape, when combined they form a fun, innovative and flexible game play system.  Players can cast two dice which allows them to move their player token(s) in a variety of ways.

In order to expand the usage of this new dice form I invented a short, repeatable and fun game. The game I created is a 1x5 spaces game called "Yoncollon Duel".

The goal of the game is to be first to move your three pieces from your side to the opposite side.

Players : 2
Board : 1x5 board
Pieces : Players have 3 pieces each.
Bet chips : Players have 5 discs each.
Dice : a pair of  classic speed dice and modern speed dice. Players decide which dice edition to use before the game. 
Game goal : Be the first player to move your three pieces from your side to the opposite side.
Decide first player and then alternate turns.  Players cast two dice then move their piece(s) by the moving rule below at their turn.

A: Move one piece with sum of dice pip(s).
B : Move two pieces according to each die pip(s). Players can decide their first move pip(s).
Pieces must land on open spaces jumping other pieces on the board and must reach the opposite side exactly. If player has no legal place to move at his turn,  then he loses the game. If players have only one piece, moving a piece by either one of dice pips is considered a legal move.

—description from the designer

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Poison Ivy (New 52)
Description:
With this new profile, Poison Ivy has developed her toxin’s power to its ultimate level, and is now capable of dealing a mortal blow to those foolish enough to get up close and personal.

This iteration of Ivy is more prone to melee attack damage than her previous corebox iteration, but she has some new heavy protection, who will ensure that she only suffers what they cannot take on her behalf. Keeping her protected is our recommendation.

Poison Ivy (New 52) can be played, with the Carnivorous Plants Rex in Versus mode.

She also can be played, with the corebox’s Carnivorous Plants in Adventure Mode’s missions:


     Plants Invasion
     Jungle Madness (Wayne Manor expansion)
     Every mission from the Suicide Squad expansion’s campaign (Crocodile Day and the others), where she can be accompanied by her Carnivorous Plants OR her Carnivorous Plants Rex.


—description from the publisher

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Batman (New 52) and Rookie
Description:
For a time, a government program saw commissioner Gordon donning the mantle of Gotham City’s protector. But he wasn’t alone; he was accompanied by a huge robot affectionately named « Rookie ».

Surgical muscle implantation and intense training augmented his fighting ability and agility, allowing him to face his fears and push beyond his prior limits. And his detective skills, honed over the years as Police Commissioner, were as sharp as ever.

His moral compass, unchanged, still guided him towards the pursuit of justice. The government tech allowed Rookie to be at his side, under his guidance, providing mission support.

In gameplay terms, Gordon controls Rookie using his Command skill, but instead of GCPD officers it’s a super heavy Bat-suit Bot striking fear into Gotham’s’ criminal underworld.

Batman (New 52) and Rookie are both playable in Versus mode. Batman (New 52) (with Rookie’s tile) can be substituted in the following corebox Adventure Mode Missions: "Deadly Infection" and "Good Cops / Bad Cops".

—description from the publisher

Name: Eating Vegans
Description:
In this highly strategic game entice a free range vegan to graze, plump them up, and eat them before you’re attacked. Steal vegans, cropdust neighboring ranges, and try avoiding the allure of bacon or bunnies eating what’s rightfully theirs.

This 100 card deck is packed with fun. This game is for 2-6 players and suitable for ages 8 and over. Games usually last between 15 and 30 minutes. This game is based on the Trophic levels and pokes jest at the fact vegans have voluntarily lowered themselves on the food chain. In the game vegans are free range. You utilize crop cards to entice them to graze before plumping them up to ultimately harvest them for consumption.

Plant a Crop card in Your Range (players personal play area) and entice a Vegan (Male, Female, or Non-Binary) from the Free Range (face down Vegan pile) to graze. Feed a Vegan 3 Crops and they are ready to harvest. Eat your Vegan and place them in your Belly (area adjacent to Your Range). First player to eat 3 Meals wins the game.

Players may also generate Meals by utilizing a Breed card with a Male and Female Vegan, creating a Baby Vegan. You may harvest 2 Baby Vegans in Your Range as a Meal or use a Vegan Snack card with a Baby Vegan as a Meal.

Players obstruct each other's ability to harvest Vegans with Action Cards. Some action cards have attack elements, others defense / block elements, and some both.

—description from the designer

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Prof. Pyg's Gang
Description:
These freaks created by the insane Professor Pyg have two different profiles on the same double tile.

Horse Head and Bull Head are big and tough and have a nigh impenetrable defense. Their attacks are dreadful, especially when you know their weapon’s length. These creatures may perform complex manipulations, even if they are not particularly gifted at doing so.

Rooster Head and Goat Head are puny, but harder to hit. They are not as fearsome as their companions, but if you let them slip out of your sight, they’ll be behind your back in a second. Be careful of their rapid strikes, as they may injure you badly. They are capable of complex thoughts, but aren’t better than the other two with manipulations.

On top of that, their frightening look gives them significant menace. Anybody trying to sneak up close on them is instantly repelled.

Prof.Pyg is not required to be your villain in order to use the Prof. Pyg’s Gang tile. They are separate from their creator.

—description from the publisher

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – The Beast
Description:
During the time of the Soviet Union, Anatoly Knyazev became the KGB’s most ruthless assassin. His ferocity and extreme methods earned him the codename ‘The Beast’. Even after the collapse of the USSR, he remained nostalgic and committed to the ideals of the Soviet era. As a mercenary, he still favored political targets, including the President of the USA. When a contract brought him to Gotham City, he caught the attention of Batman and the two formidable warriors clashed in a series of brutal fights. Though Batman eventually defeated the mercenary, he earned himself a sworn enemy.

A former KGB agent and seasoned mercenary, this efficient killing machine is highly skilled and has mastered hand to hand combat and the art of the killshot, which is reflected in his awesome action bonuses.

He has remembered everything he learnt while following his wartorn path, especially anything explosives related.

—description from the publisher

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – The Architect
Description:
The Architect made a name for himself by launching attacks on Gotham City and targeting the Wayne, Cobblepot, Kane, and Elliot families. These bloodlines are responsible for the construction of Gotham City. But so, too, were the Gates, and beneath the Architect’s mask hides Zachary Gate, heir to the Gate family. His aim is to stand victorious over these age-old blood feuds. By combining his expertise in demolition with his detailed knowledge of the city, he is able to locate and target weak points and hideouts. He is also a dangerous hand-to-hand combatant thanks to his costume that grants him Herculean strength.

Vengeance for the persecution of his notable forefathers drives this villains’ destructive goals.

Wearing the suit his grandfather created affords him tremendous fortitude as he plans massive swathes of destruction throughout the city thanks to his extensive knowledge of explosives.

It also allows him to create pathways through the city – where there were none before.

—description from the publisher

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Nobody
Description:
Bruce Wayne is Nobody’s nemesis.

This assassin’s camouflage armor provides good protection, but its stealth abilities allows Nobody to simply fade out of his enemy’s sight and then strike that fatal blow.

Killing close up or at a distance is an easy task for this martial arts master and moving at heights is a breeze due to his superb agility.

Nobody can be used in the corebox Adventure Mode mission "Like Father, Like Daughter" and is fully recruit able in Versus Mode missions.

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – The Great White Shark
Description:
Warren White was a notorious trader on the Gotham Stock Exchange. His ruthless methods garnered him the nickname "The Great White Shark". When his embezzlements landed him in court, White pleaded insanity and was sent to Arkham Asylum. There, he was tortured and abused by fellow inmates, and by the time he was released he bore severe physical and psychological scars. With stark white skin and a pair of "gills" (thanks to Killer Croc), his physical appearance now befit his nickname. As just another freak in the criminal underworld, he chose to carve a niche for himself by ousting the Penguin and working with Black Mask.

Warren White doesn’t regret his mishap in Mr Freeze’s cell; his physical and mental transformation elevated him to criminal Kingpin status.

His strategic and tactical leadership lets him position his men exactly where they are needed.

His direct support is more often than not required in order to achieve his goals.

Physical strength not being his key strength, he prefers to lurk in the background until the moment presents itself to deliver that fatal blow.

The Great White Shark is recruitable in Versus mode and can be substituted in the following core box Adventure Mode Mission: "Good Cops/Bad Cops".

—description from the publisher

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Ghost Dragons
Description:
Shen Fang’s elite assassins are fearsome melee opponents, masters of the martial arts and ready to pounce at a moment’s notice.

Flame skill greatly increases their havoc potential, but watch out, those flames can affect everyone, not just their opponents.

These fiery dragons are swappable with elite characters in the following core box Adventure Mode missions: "To Sink a City", "Suicide Escape", and "Like Father Like Daughter".

They are also fully recruitable in Versus Mode.

—description from the publisher

References
BAT19
EANâ€¯:â€¯3760271440802

Name: The Cinderella Game
Description:
Find a a coachman, a crown, and a glass slipper... and win your dream prince for life.

—description from the back of the box

The Cinderella Game is designed with young children in mind.  The game comes with a unique two-part game board that lets players create their own adventures.  Children will be captivated by the detailed illustration and innovative game play."

Name: Lootsville
Description:
Lootsville is a strategy game where you roll dice to take all your opponent's loot by moving them around the streets on the board. You first hide your loot in any area of town on the 4 pointed star spots on the board. Place you team on the starts spots and begin play. Be the first to return all you opponent’s gemstones to your base. Your team is one Officer and two Bandits. Work them together to take your opponent's gemstones before they can take all of yours. Guard your part of town while your Bandits loot other parts. If your bandits get caught and get locked up, use your Officer to let them free. The Officer is the only one who have the keys to the jails on your corner of town.

—description from the designer

Name: Princess Wands
Description:
Cooperative Story Game about the Adventures of Alina, Mckenzlie, Hanna and Starry as they take on Dragonthorn and make games with their wands. Learn how they influence the dragon to give up his gold and give him a new name. Move your character portraits around the board as you read the story. The character portraits go to the locations on the game board to match the scenes in the book. Once you have mastered the lore and learned how the wands work, use the playing cards to play out the CARD GAME! Matching the characters on the cards you force other players to draw cards based on how many characters you match! If you put the wands together you win the game!

—description from the designer

Name: Treasure Monsters
Description:
Treasure Monsters is a turn based strategy game where you need to find all your opponent's hidden bags of treasure with pawns that you move to occupy a square on the board. Be the first to return them to your base and win the game! You need to dig through the pile of buff tiles in the middle row of the board to create a way to get to the other side. You use one of your Diggerdo pawns to turn over tiles on your opponent’s side of the game board, digging up treasure in a square. Once you successfully find all 5 bags of treasure in your opponent’s base and use your Gobbler pawn to bring them back to your base, you win the game!

—description from the designer

Name: La Scamorra
Description:
An abstract 1vs1 strategy game inspired by chess, roshambo (AKA RockPaperScissors), traditional italian card games and the awesome videogame 'Pawnbarian'.

Game is played on a 5x5 checkerboard and each player has 3 different pieces representing the 3 symbols of Roshambo. 
Each player also has a deck of chess cards to play.

Similar to a trump game each player has a 3 cards hand from which, in turn, they play a card. They then proceed to move one of their pieces according to the chess moving scheme represented on the card (if you play a bishop you can move any of your pieces as if it was a bishop).

Pieces are captured the same way you do in chess, but following the roshambo logic (eg: a scissor piece can only capture a paper piece).
After a player has moved he draws another card and the turn passes to his opponent.

Pieces  captured can be respawned in game using special cards and every capture is a point.

After 15 turns the game ends and the player with the highest score wins. If a player is able to capture all 3 pieces of his opponent before he is able to respawn any of them the game ends immediately by knockout.

Full rules and manual can be found on the official Scamorra site.

Name: Takes & Adders
Description: Snakes and ladders but using cards rather than dice to move.

Name: Tiny Epic Vikings: Deluxe Edition
Description:
In the frigid Runic Isles of the North Sea, the Vikings reign supreme. These determined explorers navigate the icy fjords, build fertile settlements upon rocky crags, and fight for the glory of their clans with blood and steel. Only the Gods stand above them, and it is every Vikings’ dream to serve their God in the afterlife, Valhalla.

Tiny Epic Vikings is a fast playing 1-4 player strategy game of drafting, area control, and set collection.

In Tiny Epic Vikings, players lead a clan of Vikings over 3 eras, in hopes of claiming the icy lands for their own. They play Viking Cards that represent their clan’s leaders, choosing the best builders, harvesters, explorers, and warriors. Raid and conquer the islands with settlers, build boats and temples to gain influence, and battle for the favor of the gods!

The Shamans mini expansion brings new powerful leaders to your clan. They will enhance your runic favor and boost the god's fury like never before! Cairn tokens will encourage even more battling and will reward you bonuses on following actions for doing so. Beware though, Loki and Hel await to show off their tricky and treacherous powers!

Name: Micro Bots: Power Up!
Description: An expansion for Micro Bots: Duel, containing two new robots and Power Tokens with various additional effects.

Name: Taste of China
Description:
Chinese culinary delights are within reach of your shopping basket. You will need to be fast and quick-sighted in order to bring some home. Ready, steady, go!

After all the tiles have been displayed, the first player turns a card showing an ingredient.  The players have now to find the way of a single colour leading to the ingredient before the other players do.

Name: Adventures of Alice in Wonderland Game
Description:
This is a simple race game depicting Alice's fall down the rabbit hole, illustrated with black-and-white scenes from Paramount Pictures' "Alice in Wonderland" (1933), starring Charlotte Henry.

—user summary

Name: Balancing Act
Description:
Balancing Act is a quick playing card game where players are creating Circus Acts by playing a card from their hand and taking all the cards in the center row that are either higher valued or lower valued than that card they played. Those cards either go in their Acts creating sequential runs of cards or into their hands to be played later. Beware though you can only have so many Acts that score positive points and every card in your hand scores you negative points!

There are some special cards in the game:

     The Elephant when played allows to you play a card from your hand to one of your Acts. This is the only way you can play a card from your hand. 
     The Zebra is a wild card and worth +1 point in your Acts, but prevents you from playing cards after it.
     The Giraffe is wild as well, however it is -2 points.


The game ends when the deck of 54 cards runs out and whoever has the most points is the winner!

—description from the designer

Name: The Lantern Issue One
Description:
The Lantern, issue 1, is a zine for the Four Against Darkness solo RPG.

Issue 1 includes:

Tumbarr, the Curse of the Unliving ones (adventure)
The Lair of the Four-Headed Hydra (adventure)
Four Against the Goblin King (adventure)
Den of the Man-Wolves (adventure)
The Sea King's Orcas (faction)
Two new monsters, 1 new spells and 4 new magic items.

The first print run included two personalized pages by Four Against Darkness creator Andrea Sfiligoi. One included an ink sketch and another a personalized rule that the owner of the zine is allowed to use in the game. These were different in every copy, so no two copies of the zine were exactly the same.

Reprints, without the custom drawn pages, are available on the web.

Name: The Lantern Issue Two
Description:
Lantern Issue 2 - a zine filled with adventures and playable materials for Four Against Darkness.

In issue two:

Watery Cave of the Witch (adventure)
The Origin of the Horned Owlbear (lore and stats)
The Mushroom Menace (adventure)
The Mists of Warunor (campaign)
The Uncharted Settlement (adventure)
Requires only the Four Against Darkness book.

Name: Hex up!
Description:
Hex Up! contains 6 different games that will bring you 6 different game experiences.

Individual game variants:

Pack. Everyone plays at the same time, no matter the order. Players take hexes from the table, combine them on top of each other and layer them on top of the community deck in the rack. Each player's job is to quickly find a suitable hex, or suitably combine two hexes on top of each other in their hand and place it on the deck in the rack, suits up. The move cannot be corrected once it has been placed.
     
    Land. Each player has their own topping deck of hexes (face down in front of them), with 3 hexes laid out face up in front of them, and an initial supply of chips. Players regularly rotate their turns clockwise. Once all players have run out of their reload pack and their unloaded supply of hexes, the game ends and the player with the most coins wins.

Speed. Each player creates their own top-up deck from their hexes, and places it face down in front of them. The game ends when all players have run out of hexes in the replenishment deck. The player with the most coins wins.

Bluff: The object of the game is to get as many coins as possible by collecting all suits in a player's hand. The player with the most coins at the end of the game wins.

Think. The solving team closes their eyes, the entering team stacks the assignment on the table. On command, the solving team looks at the table and views the assignment for 1 minute. The team's task is to identify which suits and in which positions are hidden on the covered assignment by placing the corresponding chips around the card. The solving team gets as many coins as they hit the correct colors and holes. In the next round, the teams' roles are reversed. The team with the most coins after six rounds wins.

Code: The object of the game is to get as many coins as possible, which a player gets whenever his personal color combination appears on the deck.  The game ends when all players run out of hexes both in the recharge deck and in their hand. The player with the most coins wins.

Name: Secret Order
Description:
Welcome to the real power that rules the world. Filled with ambitious members, our Secret Order all manoeuvre and connive our way to the highest echelons of humanity. By dominating the five key realms of society we impose our will upon the world.

In Secret Order you all have your own agenda. These power struggles are represented by the gathering of favour tiles. Each favour represents a weapon of manipulation to be used in the subjugation of the realms of society. Using the right power in the right market in integral to achieving your ultimate goal.

As with any behind the scenes machinations, it is unwise to reveal every tool at your disposal. Secret Order is no different. So when playing "The Game" you have tiles in the open for all to see but you also have your hidden agenda, secreted away until the time is right to strike!

Gather favour tiles, spend them to use your powers to disrupt your opponent's plans, hide them away until the time is right or collect the entire set of your desire to achieve victory and domination.

Secret Order is a fast paced game of hidden motives, power plays and ambition that will have you playing again and again.

—description from the designer

Name: BALL American Football Board Game
Description:
BALL is a turn-based board game for two players. Both the aesthetics of the game and the rules are inspired by American football. The main objective of the game is to score a touchdown. Luck, elements of randomness or chance do not intervene in the game. Strategy is everything. Concentration, foresight and the development of game tactics are the key.

—description from the designer

Name: Das Rhön-Spiel
Description:
The game is a mixture between dice game and quiz game set in a German area named 'Rhön'.

The game was conceived with the idea of getting to know the natural beauty and sights of the Hessian-Bavarian-Thuringian low mountain range Rhön.

—user summary

Name: Ashfall
Description:
Ashfall is a 1-4 player coop deck building sci-fi narrative driven miniatures board game – take control of powerful unique characters, recruit  allies, find and buy rare equipment and fill your deck with powerful action cards. Explore diverse terrains from deserts to mysterious alien facilities and make use of Pelagium – a dangerous new resource. The centrepiece is an epic character and narrative driven cooperative campaign. You can also play standalone scenarios.

The Core Lands Protectorate (CLP), an expansionist state based on the southern two continents in the world, has for the past 40 years slowly absorbed all neighboring nations. With its powerful military and vast industrial base, the CLP has faced little organized opposition. Major Mak Yerrym and his group of special operations soldiers is sent to deal with the latest uprising in Artusa, a recently conquered nation. There, he discovers disturbing evidence that threatens to destabilize an uneasy peace between the two superpowers of the world.

The Yarangan Union (YU) is a scientifically advanced nation based in the northern archipelagos with unmatched naval power - fleets of advanced self-sufficient ships known as Umiaqs powered by Pelagium (a rare and powerful resource). In the past several decades the YU’s Pelagium research has rapidly advanced under the supervision of renowned scentist Toerwahn Tijksyn. With his recent disappearance, research has stalled. His daughter, Mira Tijksyn, is sent on an expedition escorted by members of the secretive YU State Security. There, she begins to understand the source of her father’s discoveries.

As players, take on the role of characters on both sides of the developing conflict and together uncover a vast conspiracy that threatens to bring the world into a devastating war that could destroy both nations, or worse.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monster Munch
Description:
Flip over as many serving dishes as possible to fill your monster quickly, but be careful! Mixed among the delicacies are some foods that the monsters don't like at all! You'll have to remember where they are. The first player to reach the end of the buffet and get back again wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Monopoly: Magyarország
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Hungary.

Name: Local de Ensayo
Description:
It's your time, now you can become the author you've always wanted and set up the group you've always dreamed of for the next COAC (Cadiz's Carnival Contest). But be careful, the rest of the authors will have their mission, to annoy you and to lead a better group than yours.

This card driven game lets you get a band together to compete in Cadiz's (Spain) most prestigious contest.

This is a filler game for anyone who wants to dare to put together a group for the next COAC. You can play from 2 to 6 players and being 7 years old is enough to be able to join the game, which will last between 15 and 30 minutes.

Name: とりてこ (Torite Co)
Description:
Torite Co (Trick Taking by Coffee Ritokon Blend) is a must-follow team-based trick taking game where the goal is to brew as much coffee as possible because your wage depends on it!

The setting is a popular cafe, and the players divide into two teams to brew coffee. Brewing more coffee than the opposing team is the winning condition of this game.

In Torite Co, players will always be divided into two teams. If you play with 4 or more people, you may not know know who your teammate is (due to identity concealment).

Therefore, you can unintentionally help the opposing team, or there may also be situations where teammates drag each other down.

In addition to the identity concealment element, in the case of 4 and 5 players, it can be an irregular team structure (1 to 3 or 2 to 3). If it becomes one-on-three, it may be difficult to win on one side, but the sense of accomplishment when you win will be higher than when you win 2 vs 2…

—description from the publisher (translated)

The 3 main wrinkles of this game:

The secret teammate component is similar to Doppelkopf where the “part-time leader” calls out a specific card to indicate that the player with that card is now on their team (this player does not have to reveal who they are). The leader also chooses the Trump suit for the round.

Tricks can be worthless or count for multiple points, as only  Coffee Cards (8-A) count for points.

2 is considered the highest number (still lower than A and T) when the trick is entirely comprised of the same suit.

Name: Fort Jefferson Attack Game
Description: The Fort Jefferson Attack game is a low to moderate complexity tactical game covering the Chickasaw attack on Fort Jefferson during the American Revolutionary War. The game takes about 90 minutes to play. One player commands the Americans and their allies, and the other player commands the Chickasaws.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Battle Series of World Battles (Historical Game Company)

Name: Battle of Baton Rouge Game
Description: The Battle of Baton Rouge is a low to moderate complexity tactical game covering the Spanish attack against the British redoubt at Baton Rouge in 1779 during the American Revolutionary War. The game takes 90 minutes to play. One player commands the Spanish forces and the other player commands the British forces.
Families: Series: Battle Series of World Battles (Historical Game Company)

Name: Inheritance
Description:
Wedding bells are ringing! The successor to the most powerful family in the Kingdom is without a partner. How will you position yourself to win their favour and get a piece of the grand inheritance?

In Inheritance, each player tries to prove their legitimacy as a suitor by addressing the ever changing desires of a fickle successor and their family. Use your influence to manipulate these desires. The nature of your proposal will be of great importance, which will lead to your success? A Declaration of true love? A proclamation of peace? A generous dowry? perhaps a declaration of War!

Each turn you'll play one card from your hand that can either influence the successor's family, or change the terms of the wedding proposal. Choose carefully to ensure your selected Admirer is favoured. You win the game if you start your turn as the favoured Admirer.

—description from the publisher

Name: Schadenfreude: Add-on Ritterorden
Description:
Expansion for Schadenfreude that allows for play of Sweets in Wonderland. Uses the same deck and score track

Contains:
1 rulebook
25 knight chips (equivalent to sweet chips)
5 castle boards (equivalent to plate boards)
2 order boards (equivalent to order boards)
1 Unity of the Legion boards (equivalent to tea card)

Name: Western Europe Xpress
Description:
Western Europe Xpress is a fast paced, card driven, operational game in which players compete to develop the best networks of industry and rails by using multi-purpose cards.   The players compete to develop the most profitable board position over six decades.

At the beginning of each decade, 12 demand cards are dealt in a tableau.  Each of the three regions, (France, Germania, and the Southeast) scores revenue once its available cards for drafting are taken by the players, so they must balance their timing with their development as they jockey for the best position.  Playtime is 30 minutes per player or less once they know the rules.

Name: SKAL!
Description:
SKAL! (or SKÅL!) is a Viking-themed dice-stacking dexterity-based drinking game!  Designed by Andrew Prowse, art and illustrations by Janette Ramos, graphic design by Sebastian Koziner, published by Gameland and distributed by Spiral Games and Quartermaster Logistics.

Players take on the roles of Viking gods and goddesses: Odin, Loki, Thor, Freya, Idunn and Heimdall.  Everyone collects a player mat, coloured dice and drinking cup. Each turn, the leading player turns over a card, showing an arrangement of dice then the players race to stack their own dice (plus extra from a shared pile) to match the pattern on the card.  They then grab their cups, raise them into air and call out, “SKÅL!” (Cheers in Norwegian).  Whoever does this first wins the card, which is worth 1 or 2 points, depending upon difficulty.  The first player to 9 points wins!

There are extra cards, rules, special powers and added challenges to keep the game interesting.  It can be played as a fun family game or as a rowdy adults-only drinking game if you choose. It plays really quickly (10 – 20 mins) and will be fast-paced, loud, exciting and fun!

—description from the designer

Name: SubDown
Description:
You are crew members of a submarine that has suffered great damage in an accident. All systems are down. The life support system is compromised and soon the CO2 level will rise to a lethal level.

It's important that you work together quickly as a team to get the engines working again and get to the rescuing surface.

SubDown is cooperative game for up to 4 people by Diego Albuja Ortiz, where you play in different roles of a submarine crew using your different skills to repair the technical equipment using spare parts before you run out of air.

Place three of the four engine cards in the center of the table and choose a crew card for each. Three markers each go into your action supply, and three more go into your energy supply.

At the beginning of a round, turn over a Spare Parts card.

Take turns placing a marker from an Action Supply onto one or more Spare Parts.

If you lack the appropriate skill in your role, you may still place a marker on the card, but you must also place a marker in your energy supply. The task has you particularly strained.

Every now and then, you'll need to rest instead so that you can replenish your action supply.

If a spare part has all the markers you need on it, you may use it to start repairing a machine by placing one of the markers on it. Each color may only appear once.

When you have completely repaired a machine with the help of the spare parts, it is ready for use again and you may turn over a training card. You can use this card at any time and use its effect, but only once in the whole game.

One allows you to take a break all together and regenerate forces. The other allows you to move up to three markers from one spare part to another at will.

If you manage to repair all three machines before you have used up the spare parts deck twice, you will survive!

If not, the CO2 level will rise too far and you will be trapped at the bottom of the ocean ...

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Ahotnik
Description:
DISCLAIMER
One of our authors is Moldavian and she loves her culture and her language so much she wanted to put some of that love in our game. We can assure you that everything you see in Ahotnik is related to the fictional world we created for our game. The only place we can accept fighting and war is in a boardgame, other than that, as authors, players and human beings, we strongly reject war and violence and we firmly stand for peace and inclusivity.


In Ahotnik, the players form pairs and act as the pilots of giant robots called “Ahotniks”—each of which has its own unique designation of “OXO-##”, for this reason, they are also known as “OXOs”. Their goal is to be the first team to eliminate a rival Ahotnik. But, during their battles, otherworldly creatures referred to as “Demons” emerge from mysterious Portals and try to wreak havoc on Earth by destroying the Ahotniks. The teams must fight on both fronts if they are going to be the one to bring glory to their nation! But beware: Your thirst for power must not come at the cost of total global annihilation…

A game of Ahotnik is played over a series of rounds which are divided into 4 phases:


     Pilot Phase:
 Pilot pairs try to coordinate by using their Action tiles, which represent the cerebral commands they send to the Ahotnik. The success of their strategy depends on their level of synchrony. 
     Ahotnik Phase:
 The Ahotniks operate in this phase depending on the actions thought up by the pilots in the Pilot Phase. In order, the OXOs will carry out:
         Tactical Actions: A set of actions that can have offensive, defensive, or strategic effects.
         Movement Actions: Move the OXO on the game board.
         Attack Actions: The main (though not the only) method to damage your enemies.
    
     Demon Phase:
Beware of incoming threats! This is the turn of any Demons in play. The Radar will also indicate if any new Portals open and increase the Global Threat Level this turn.
     Recovery Phase:
Certain game elements are restored so a new round may begin. 


Rounds are repeated until an Ahotnik falls victim to another OXO or a Demon. Who will achieve total dominion of the planet?

Name: Vrahode: The Enlightened & The Enslaved
Description: The game is a solo/co-op game (expansion) for 1-6 players, 14+ and is compatible with Weathervane Games' proprietary 3D terrain system called Harbinger which is used for dynamic multi level spaces. In this 1st expansion for Vrahode: The Calteeryn Ascension (the core game) the prophecy is fulfilled but only now do our heroes know the horrible truths of what lay ahead. Far greater dangers begin to encircle the world of Vrahode and hidden dangers begin to surface and step into the light. Where must the party go to find the help they need to face these new threats? Perhaps the places you fear most will unlock the way forward! New quests in the Underland, new Harbinger tiles, new enemies! All games in the series are part of the Vrahode Game System which invites players to generate their own content adding to the expanding lore of Vrahode!

Name: Vrahode: Facing The Storm
Description: Vrahode is an adventure/dungeon crawl board game series. The game is a solo/co-op game for 1-6 players, 14+ and compatible with Weathervane Games' proprietary 3D terrain system called Harbinger which is used for dynamic multi level spaces. In this 2nd expansion we find at the root of the chaos reigns an entity of immense power. Its reach and influence is ever growing and twisting the minds of everything it touches. Into that maelstrom of corruption is precisely where our path leads us. There will be no rest until this enemy is eliminated because soon its tendrils of control may consume us all! This expansion features new enemies, tons of new quests in in the Overlands, Underlands and at sea! Lots of new Harbinger tiles including the Dungeon Riser which allows you to raise an 18X18" tile up to two levels and making five level dungeons possible! All games in the series are part of the Vrahode Game System which invites players to generate their own content adding to the expanding lore of Vrahode!

Name: Vrahode: The False Gods' Deceit
Description:
Vrahode is an adventure/dungeon crawl board game series designed by Jeffrey Irving. The game is a solo/co-op game for 1-6 players, 14+ and is compatible with Weathervane Games proprietary 3D terrain system called Harbinger which is used for dynamic multi level spaces. All games in the series are part of the Vrahode Game System which invites players to generate their own content adding to the expanding lore of Vrahode!

In this third expansion weary from many battles, somehow our heroes manage to raise their heads to the sky again toward where they now know the true source of the danger emanates! With every once of resolve they can muster, and bolstered with more powerful weapons, armor and ruhl (magic) they press on to find and destroy those which seek to control Vrahode and make them slaves. They must end the lies of the enemy and become the sword of the creator in their vengeance! New quests in the Overland, Underland and at sea, new enemies and brutal challenges lay ahead as you battle toward the most complex and challenging multi level dungeon ever created for a board game! It's gonna get bloody!

Name: The Great Escape: Day 1
Description:
In this expansion for The Great Escape, it is day 1 in camp and as the POWs are processed into the camp you must decide how best to deploy them by strategically placing cards within the camp layout.

Do you try and help 1 or 2 POWs escape today or do you concentrate your efforts towards a mass escape at a later date?

Or maybe you really do deserve the title of Big X and can achieve all of the following objectives:

     On the way to camp help 1 POW leap from the transporter and flee into the forest.
     Hide POWs amongst the forced labour gang as they are taken out into the forest to work.
     Hide POWS in the trucks that are about to be cleared for departure.
     Set up a lookout system.
     Designate POWs to create distractions.
     Find a blind spot in the outer fence.
     Discover the identity of the spy.
     Blackmail a guard.
     Produce disguises for escaping POWs.
     Choose a hut in which to hide wire cutters.
     Tunnel to the administration offices.
     Dispose of soil from the tunnels.


Guard cards will be used to continually thwart your escape attempts.

—description from the designer

Name: Бизнесмен
Description:
The economic game Ð‘Ð¸Ð·Ð½ÐµÑÐ¼ÐµÐ½ ("Businessman") is one of the first advanced economic games in Russia, very similar to Monopoly.

Playing it, you get into a fascinating world of simulated financial operations, helping you better understand such matters as "Stock Exchange", "Stocks", "Bankruptcy", try your hand at fighting the competition.

Participating in this game requires the exercise of a number of qualities - mathematical abilities, the ability to quickly navigate in different situations, stimulating the development of memory, observation, and attention.

Ð‘Ð¸Ð·Ð½ÐµÑÐ¼ÐµÐ½ is a family game for all age groups starting from 8-9 years old and the number of participants from two to six people.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Arena of Shades
Description:
On the shores of Aqshy's Charrwind Coast, the city of Har Kuron stands as a stronghold of the Khainite faith. Once called Anvilgard, it was seized by the armies of Morathi in a bloody coup, and now they exercise iron-handed dominion over the region. Yet unbeknownst to the aelves, they have come to the vengeful attention of Nagash, Supreme Lord of the Undead. At the behest of the Great Necromancer, the Craven King Kurdoss Valentian has dispatched a host of spectral warriors to ravage Har Kuron and return to Shyish with a grim bounty of souls.

Whether you're a devotee of the Bloody-handed God or a servant to the Lord of Undeath, this battlebox provides a sizeable force to suit your needs, as well as seven entirely new miniatures – the deadly High Gladiatrix, cruel Scriptor Mortis, and soul-hunting Craventhrone Guard. The murderous zealots of the Daughters of Khaine are perfect for those who like to move fast and hit hard, dicing their opponents in a dance of death, while the terrifying hosts of the Nighthaunt are ideal for anyone who wants to drag their enemies to the underworld with relentless spite and spectral powers.

Start a new fighting force as you pick a side in the battle for Har Kuron, or bolster your existing army with reinforcements.

Inside, you’ll find 44 plastic Citadel miniatures, including:

     1x High Gladiatrix
     10x Sisters of Slaughter, also able to be built as Witch Aelves
     5x Khinerai Heartrenders, also able to be built as Khinerai Lifetakers
     5x Doomfire Warlocks



     1x Scriptor Mortis
     5x Craventhrone Guard
     10x Bladegheist Revenants
     1x Spirit Torment
     2x Chainghasts
     4x Myrmourn Banshees


You'll also find:

     A 56-page Warhammer Age of Sigmar Core Rules book
     A 40-page Arena of Shades booklet
     10x Warscroll Cards
     1x Token Board, containing 36 tokens
     2x Range Rulers (9")
     1x Transfer sheet for use with the Daughters of Khaine miniatures in this set


The Arena of Shades booklet tells the story of the struggle for Har Kuron's souls, as the Daughters of Khaine dash forth from their gladiatorial pits to push back the invading Nighthaunt. You’ll find lore for the Charrwind Coast, rules for fighting in the streets and tunnels of the benighted city, plus warscrolls for all included units and a campaign of three new battleplans for use in open play and narrative games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

You will also find a copy of the Warhammer Age of Sigmar core rules in this box. This book contains a Conquest Unbound section featuring rules for more unusual types of battles in the Mortal Realms including Siege Warfare, Tunnel Fighting, and Triumph and Treachery multiplayer games for three or more factions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Fury of the Deep
Description:
The Age of Sigmar: Fury of the Deep set gives you everything you will need to create a battle between the Fyreslayers and the Idoneth Deepkin, it's packed full of enough miniatures to literally start a war as well as rules, lore, Warscrolls and more. Including two never before seen miniatures, Akhelian Thrallmaster and The Auric Flamekeeper. These models will lead the two armies into battle, but who will come out on top is down to you.

Fyreslayers are born from the furnaces deep within mountain vaults, bellowing mighty war cries as they charge into the fray swinging their deadly battle axes. They carry little in the way of armour to protect themselves, instead blessed with the power of their God magical ur-gold runes that are seared into their flesh, allowing their God's power to flow through their veins and provide them with abilities of more resilient skin and increased strength to cleave their enemies in two and shrug off wounds that would slay a normal warrior. What drives the Duardin Fyreslayers ever on is the promise of gold to be won, to fulfil their oaths by vanquishing their enemies and the chance to honour the spirit of Grimnir.

The Idoneth Deepkin are a cursed people. When Teclis took his due of Aelven souls from the captive Slaanesh he crafted a new race that he hoped would embody the virtues of the Aelves from the world that was. He failed. The creatures he created were not untainted by their time within the God of Excess, holding within themselves a deep well of darkness. Horrified at his failure, Teclis attempted to eradicate his newly created children but could not act before they fled, far into the deepest oceans of the Ethersea. There they multiplied only to discover to their horror that the majority of their children possessed withered souls. Few survived beyond birth and fewer still to adulthood so a decision was made. In order to safeguard the lives of those few children that survived the Idoneth would need to graft healthy souls to theirs thus do the Idoneth venture into the mortal realms on raids to enslave living captives to be donors and ensure the future of their race.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Echoes of Doom
Description:
When the verminous skaven make a daring raid on the innocent Sylvaneth enclave of Neos, Grey Seer Skrittat's successful theft of priceless soulpods sets in motion a devastating counterstrike – for the Lady of Vines and her hand-picked Sylvaneth warriors have a thirst for vengeance that can only be quenched by a lake of spilled skaven blood…

Whether you have pledged your life to the Everqueen or have dedicated yourself to learning the ways of the insidious Clans Eshin, this battlebox provides a sizeable force to suit your needs, as well as several entirely new miniatures – the vengeful Lady of Vines, the deadly Gossamid Archers, and the treacherous Deathmaster, who may have an agenda all of his own. The graceful warriors of the Everqueen are ideal for players who like to be fast and agile, while the slinking agents of the skaven overwhelm their opponents with sheer strength of numbers.

Start a new fighting force (or two) as you choose to either save the sacred soulpods or steal them, or bolster your existing armies with reinforcements.

Inside, you’ll find 42 plastic Citadel miniatures, including:


     1x The Lady of Vines
     1x Spirit of Durthu, which can alternatively be build as either a Treelord or a Treelord Ancient
     3x Kurnoth Hunters
     5x Gossamid Archers



     1x Deathmaster
     1x Grey Seer on Screaming Bell, which can alternatively be built as a Plague Priest on Plague Furnace
     10x Stormvermin
     20x Clanrats


You'll also find:


     1x 40-page Echoes of Doom booklet
     1x 56-page Warhammer Age of Sigmar Core Rules book
     1x Token Sheet
     8x Warscroll Cards


In this box, you will find all the Citadel miniatures you need to play out the brutal conflict between the vengeful Sylvaneth and the thieving skaven. Alongside these two armies you will find a book of detailed background information on the narrative of Echoes of Doom and the two factions involved. Also included are warscrolls and battleplans that allow you to start playing with your new armies right away, as well as extra rules content such as Region of War: The Adamantine Chain, Aqshy.

—descripton from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Chaos Battletome – Maggotkin of Nurgle
Description:
To the tolling of rusted bells, the Maggotkin bring disease and despair to the realms. Revolting worshippers of Nurgle, the Chaos God of plagues and entropy, they live to bring others into his fold by sharing with them his foul gifts. Given strength by the maladies that blight their flesh, the Maggotkin serve Grandfather Nurgle with furious zeal. Armies of infected mortals fight alongside droning plague-daemons, spreading pestilence to all and sundry. They would not see the realms burn, however. Instead, they seek to transform them into reeking, squelching extensions of Nurgle’s Garden, writhing and pulsating with disgusting life.

In this book, you'll learn everything there is to know of the foul pestilences of Nurgle and his corrupted followers who wage war with rusted weapons and diseased touch. Discover the garden of Nurgle and Grandfather's never-ending quest to extend his rotting gifts across the whole of the Mortal Realms, as well as the feculent legions that march out to spread entropy and decay.

This 104-page hardback book contains:


     A pestilent bounty of lore and background information all focussed on Grandfather Nurgle and the daemons and mortals that live only to spread his poxes
     Stunning art that covers the repulsive Maggotkin hordes in all their bubonic beauty
     27 warscrolls and pitched battle profiles that cover everything from the mighty Glottkin brothers to the rotting Putrid Blightkings and the lowliest Nurglings
     Allegiance abilities for your Maggotkin armies that cover how your forces infect their enemies with diseases, how to manage Cycle of Decay, as well as command traits, artifacts of power, and the 6 legions and contagiums of Nurgle
     7 warscroll battalions for Path to Glory narrative campaigns
     Path to Glory campaign rules allowing you to undertake quests to seed the garden of Nurgle and fight across blighted battlegrounds
     Content for matched play, including 4 grand strategies, 6 battle tactics, and 2 core battalions
     A wonderful photo showcase covering the menagerie of morbid miniatures which make up Maggotkin armies, and guides for how to paint your own army
     Background information on every Maggotkin of Nurgle unit, including characters like Rotigus, and Horticulus Slimux.


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Order Battletome – Fyreslayers
Description:
The Fyreslayers are a culture of duardin whose entire existence revolves around battle, renowned for their short tempers and unrivalled skill with the axe.
